newsitem.title: JAPAN: Sumitomo buys stake in US cable TV venture - paper.
newsitem.headline: Sumitomo buys stake in US cable TV venture - paper.

text.p: Sumitomo Corp has purchased a stake in a California-based venture which makes cable television modems and acquired the right to market them in Japan, a Japanese business daily reported on Wednesday.
The Japanese trading house has invested $5 million in the venture, the Nihon Keizai Shimbun said.
The modems enable the provision of Internet and telecoms services via the cable television network, the newspaper said.
Sumitomo operates about 10 cable TV stations in Japan through a subsidiary, the paper said.
A Sumitomo spokesman was not immediately available for comment on the newspaper report.
